Expert: s statement: Brandon Brown, a professor at University of California, Riverside’s Center for Healthy Communities, stated that quinine in tonic water would not work as a cure for COVID-19.
Comparison of dosage: The expert mentioned that to achieve a similar effect of the drug, one would have to drink over 10 times more tonic water than humans drink water per day, which is not possible.
FDA regulations: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) restricts the amount of quinine contained in commercial beverages to 83 parts per million, indicating that it is not intended as a therapeutic dosage.
Lack of clinical evidence: The expert highlighted that quinine, chloroquine, and hydroxychloroquine are not proven to work as treatments for COVID-19 and are not approved by the FDA for such use.
